text:p.text:span: to build a clean, testable MVP:→

text:span.text:span: Make optimization simple, interpretable, and fast

text:list-item.text:p: what the user dashboard looks like

office:text.text:h: ✅ 1. Final ETF Universe for the MVP
office:text.text:p: Use 7–12 ETFs max, grouped by asset class, with long + inverse (short) versions.

text:list-item.text:p: SH – Inverse S&P 500 (–1×)(optional: SSO or SPXL if you want leverage later)
LQD – Investment-grade corporate bonds(no perfect inverse, but you can approximate via TLT+HYG mix)
SHV or SGOV – short-term Treasury ETF(acts as risk-free asset)
CMDY or SCO/CORN/GPIO if you want specific exposures
CMDY-I doesn’t exist, but you can short DBC instead
beta to SPY (to control regime sensitivity)

office:text.text:p: This alone gives you enough structure to run simple optimization.

text:list-item.text:p: max short weight per inverse ETF (e.g., 20%)
min cash = 0–30% depending on risk regime

office:text.text:p: This is FAST and extremely stable with ETFs.
This is the part where your system beats normal robo-advisors.
Use simple but powerful regime signals:

text:list-item.text:p: SPY/TLT correlation strongly negative (classic crash hedge)
commodities reduced unless inflation shock scenario

office:text.text:p: → unless risk regime flips→ OR volatility spikes > 2 stdev→ OR portfolio weights drift > 10%
office:text.text:h: 2. Apply transaction cost penalty in optimization
